intro: Psephellus calocephalus, commonly known as the mountain mallow, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Mediterranean. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
